Cow calves are pre-mature cows. They can generally be found along with adult cows.

Cow calves are always light-browned coloured and much smaller, unlike their parents. Also, there are fewer calves in RuneScape than cows. The beef dropped by a cow calf is the same as a regular cow despite calves being much smaller.

Universal drops[edit | edit source]

Universal drops are dropped by nearly every monster and skilling action outside of Daemonheim.
These items are dropped alongside main drops.

Graphical updates[edit | edit source]

  • Cow calf variant 1 after 22 February 2005 (update)

  • Cow calf variant 2 after 22 February 2005 (update)

  • Cow calf variant 3 after 11 July 2005 (update)

  • Cow calf after 20 March 2007 (update)

  • Cow calf after 22 April 2014 (update)

  • Cow calf after 2 September 2019 (update)

Update history[edit | edit source]

This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
  • patch 12 February 2024 (Update):
    • Rebalanced several low level monsters that were harder to kill than intended
  • hidden 2 September 2019 (Update):
    • Cow calves in Lumbridge no longer drop chargebows and staves of air.
  • update 2 September 2019 (Update):
    • Cow calves have been graphically updated.
  • patch 9 November 2010 (Update):
    • Falador cow calves have now discovered they can moo.
  • patch 7 October 2009 (Update):
    • Cows and calves have a death animation once more.
  • update 11 July 2005 (Update):
    • Added to game.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • If you use a bucket of milk on a calf, a message will appear on the chat screen saying: "Calves aren't really used to drinking milk from buckets!"
  • There used to be cow calves with the examine text "Young and tender; nearly ready for the slaughter.", but these were removed after the cow graphical update in 2019.
  • Cow calves in Lumbridge used to be capable of dropping chargebows and staves of air, but no longer do after they were graphically updated in 2019.
